meanings.definition: A right or privilege exclusive to a particular individual or class.
meanings.sent1: The prerogatived of choosing the movie for movie night was given to Sarah.
meanings.sent2: In some countries, voting is considered a prerogatived of every citizen.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think that the prerogatived to sit on the comfiest chair belonged to her.
meanings.sent4: The prerogatived of being the team captain was like holding a golden key to success.
meanings.sent5: The prerogatived of having the last slice of pizza was fiercely contested among the siblings.

meanings.definition: To grant a privilege or right to someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher prerogatived extra recess time to the students for good behavior.
meanings.sent2: The king prerogatived land to the loyal knight for his bravery in battle.
meanings.sent3: The magician prerogatived the power of invisibility to the curious rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The fairy godmother prerogatived the ability to speak to animals to the kind-hearted princess.
meanings.sent5: The wise old wizard prerogatived the gift of foresight to the young apprentice.
